intro: Gaultheria anastomosans, commonly known as the mountain cranberry, is a species of evergreen shrub native to the Andes Mountains. It belongs to the Ericaceae family and is characterized by its dense, compact growth habit and small, leathery leaves. The plant produces bright red berries that are edible and have a tart flavor, often used in local cuisines. Gaultheria anastomosans thrives in cool, moist environments and is adapted to high-altitude conditions. Its botanical features make it an important species in both ecological and horticultural contexts.
